answerText: Alan Paton[10] In this Paton novel, Stephen Kumalo's son Absalom is executed for his part in killing the white engineer Jarvis.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | Finals 2 | 19 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This author wrote about his time at Diepkloof Reformatory in Tales from a Troubled Land and described the arrest of the Indian Prem in Ah, but Your Land is Beautiful. For 10 points each: [10] Name this 20th century author. In his most famous novel, Theophilus Msimangu summons the protagonist to help care for his daughter and search for his son.
